caption: Had prix fixe lunch. Great food - fried chickpeas and ricotta cheese with honey for first course, short ribs and burger for second, sorbet and chocolate pot de crepe for dessert. Excellent service. Nice view.

Our Server Oscar was great! The drinks, food, dessert, and service are all fantastic. Love the atmosphere here. Already looking forward to going back and trying the rest of the menu! Their packages to go also look like great options if you're looking for some great take out!
Awesome view, great service!
Lovely place. I suggest to go with prex fixe menu. Small portions, but we were so full by the end of the dinner. Cocktails are great!

An absolutely amazing experience! First off, the entrance is Northwestern Hospital which for me, was so interesting and funny! The entrance kind of served as its own experience itself! Second off, the service was impeccable! They truly make you feel at home (Oscar was the best and even gave us the recipe to our favorite cocktail).  Third off, the food and drinks were SO flavorful and tasty!!! We did the prefix menu and I HIGHLY recommend it - what sets this place apart from other prefix menu offering restaurants is the price. $45 for a 4 course menu that includes full size entrees is hard to beat - I hope it stays that way. Additionally, they were having a 3 for $30 cocktail offering for Valentine’s Day that was amazing! Unique cocktails for such a great deal. It would be a great idea for them to adopt this to a more frequent occasion.  Overall, an amazing Valentine’s Day experience but I see myself coming back very soon for just a casual Saturday night when I want great cocktails, a great meal, and great service for a great price.
Drinks were wonderful after a day of appointments. Well spaced tables and bonus cotton candy.
Loved the atmosphere! Good wine list and delicious food! Our server was very polite! New, moder place with greatest view Highly recommend!
The burger & fries along with the apple pot pie was very delicious 😋 The cotton candy treat was cute! Will definitely come back again!
Great decor, super cool location, and killer desserts!
Had a wonderful experience tonight! The ricotta appetizer was fabulous as was the scallops and short ribs. Sensational dessert! Oscar our server was great!
Nice atmosphere, beautiful view.  Server asked about allergies and restrictions,  the chef was accommodating. I was full and satisfied. Plus I had gelato! It was made from almond milk.

Went to woodwind last night and tried their new fall menu - it was wonderful! Their cocktails were fun, innovative and delicious.  We had the scallops, lamb tacos, and the braised short ribs for our main course. My mouth is watering as I type this because it was that delicious!  We were then treated to a visually and aromatically appealing dessert (just ask about the Smokey dessert and they’ll know what you’re talking about). The view of the city was stunning and worth a stop just for that.  Looking forward to trying the other half of the menu and a few more of their craft cocktails on our next visit!  Highly recommend!
Great food and view
This place is one of the best hidden gems in the city. It has one of the greatest views in streeterville and has a great Menu. You will not be disappointed.
Amazing views of the city, basically a rooftop
Interesting location with great hospitality!

Carolina the mixologist was amazing! We loved all of our cocktails. They were so unique and different from anything we ever tend to drink. She even made a cute "kiddie," cocktail for our 2yr old. The appetizers were also phenomenal! We loved the chicharron/the maitake mushroom, the fermented hummus, the ricotta apps were so so GOOOOD! The rooftop experience was COVID19 safe by 100%, the views impecable and the atmosphere was very inviting. We are looking forward to dinner here because the dinner menu looked exquisite!! The service here was fast and friendly. Our server was super sweet to our 2yr old, as well.

I’m so glad Woodwind is open.  Amazing outdoor seating - large and beautiful with great views.  Food is amazing.  Blooming Maitake mushrooms are great.  House ricotta melts in your mouth.  Duck tacos are my favorite.  Try the smoke and mirrors, what a treat.

Disappointed, to say the least! I'll start with the food, which was amongst one of the least memorable dining experiences I've ever had. It was below average, actually way below average. The appetizers: short lamb ribs was mediocre at best, served cold, didn't have much taste to it, it was dry and came with a presentation that was unbelievably amateurish. The carrot appetizer was just some large sized, uncut whole carrots with some steak seasoning sprinkled on top which is available at Costco, nothing special about it; I can fairly compare it to some carrots bought from the Whole foods, cooked in the oven and put some seasoning on it at home! what a shame!... The main was again an extremely underwhelming cut of steak (if you can call it a steak!?!) that was fridge cold upon being served, rough texture, extremely small portion of probably 4oz? of under-seasoned cut of meat that I could only see being justified as an appetizer; the potato cubes?! that came with it was terrible, inedible, cold and hard. The salad accompanying the steak in the dish was irrelevant to the dish. It seemed like they are trying too hard but don't know what should go where. The dessert of ice cream and chocolate mousse was just that: ordinary vanilla ice cream and chocolate mousse! The Service was great and courteous, ambiance was cold and below average for what they are trying to be, so overall it was nothing special to recommend. Would I return? Definitely not, and I don't see them lasting very long purely for the absolutely mediocre food quality and extremely disappointing dishes they offer!

Amazing bar hidden on the 18th floor. Mixologists in denim aprons, well crafted cocktails, awesome appetizers. House made ricotta is especially good. Pair it with the chicken chicharones with buffalo dust and Bleu cheese foam. Also has an outdoor deck with views of lake Michigan in the warmer months.
Amazing views and we'll thought out menu. Service was a little slow on a slow night.

I had the butternut squash soup, which was way too sweet for me. The squash is sweet enough on its own, but I think perhaps the candied pepita's pushed it over the top. I asked for some bread as well, he brought "grilled focaccia" but it was pretty much just toast, so that was disappointing as well. My husband's burger and fries were good, and the sweet surprise brought to our table after lunch was a treat.  Very nice atmosphere with good views, service was excellent.

This is a spot you will never see from the street, since it's on the 18th floor of a hospital. That being said, if you want some really interesting bites and cocktails, this is a hidden gem. Food is moderately priced, but if you catch happy hour, it's a real steal.

Excellent meal and ambience. The butternut squash pappardelle, short rib, and roasted chicken were our group's favorites. The hummus was good but we didn't enjoy the vegetables - pita bread would have been preferred. Cocktails were all delicious and strong. The cashew gelato was absolutely perfect.
It wasn't crowded but the service was a little bit slow... nice happy hour selection

The view is the best part of this restaurant. The Woodwind Burger is decent, but the small portions are overpriced (probably due to the pretentious presentation, such as the soup poured at the table for seemingly no reason or the flavorless cotton candy brought out with the check). The Bloody Mary tasted like it was half hot sauce and ruined the meal for me.
Awesome drinks, great food and excellent service!
Went for a business lunch and did the price fixe menu was a great value. Service was excellent without being disruptive and the space is stunning! Great wow factor without breaking the bank.
Subpar food, subpar experience

Our whole experience was spectacular. I mentioned in the reservation that we were celebrating our anniversary and their sommelier brought over the most amazing prosecco I’d ever tasted. We ordered their ricotta, blooming maitake (which came with two shots of sake to complement the dish), the short ribs (potato scallion pancakes included), and the smoked chocolate pot de creme. Our check came with a complimentary tiramisu flavored cotton candy, which was such a fun, lovely touch. This place feels special without being stuffy or pretentious, which is the sweet spot I long for. Can not recommend this enough.
What an amazing experience! The waiters, the food, the atmosphere, the view...I will definitely be going back again.

Shared many different dishes among all of us.  Portions are small but very tasty with unique flavors. No kids menu for the two kids that were with us so they had a burger & fries.  The Smoke 'n Mirrors was really good.  Pricey...

two days ago was our first time we visited this place. But It is obviously not the last. We enjoyed the evening very much with the attentive service, with the fine  dishes and fine drinks and with the decent pay. We will definitely come back soon.

Current special: Lunch in 30 minutes or less or it's on them. Happy Hour too.  Easy access for Northwestern employees and patients.   Cozy dining space with great views. Event space too. Delicious burger and fries!

This restaurant will not survive. After they burn up the seed money it will close. My girlfriend and I went last night. The staff is extremely friendly but the food is terrible. We had the mushrooms and carrot appetizer. The carrots were so mushy it was like eating baby food. We also got the butternut squash. The server asked how we liked it and we said we didn’t, she said she would tell the chef 🙄. We didn’t eat it but they still charged us. We bought a $120 bottle of wine and my girlfriend liked it so I gave the a 2 star.  The main course we ordered was the lamb, which was good and probably the item we actually ate. The fish we ordered was dry. It had to be less than 4oz.  I couldn’t figure out what the hell this place was trying to be....  we were listening to Tom Petty, while looking at a wall, with a different server bringing over what looked and tasted like a Chef that is more interested in being called a chef than preparing just good food.  The hostess sitting in the lobby on her phone should have warned me.  I hate to give poor reviews because I know how difficult a restaurant is to own and operate but unfortunately the investors got scammed on this over priced wanna be fine dinning restaurant.  $275 for dinner and we had to eat again at 10!
Beautiful decor, great view over the city streets. Every dish comes out looking beautiful. The food is not average. They make bold combinations of flavors.

This restaurant is unbelievably good. With the hidden and unexpected setting within Northwestern Memorial Hospital deterring the average tourist, this place sets itself apart from other Mag Miles spots. The service is exceptional, the ambiance warm and welcoming, and the food — wow. Order anything; it’s all spectacular. The chef pays close attention to detail and expertly blends flavors, so that each bite of food tastes slightly different than the last. It’s such an interesting experience that I’m inclined to recommend going alone just so that you can savor every delicious flavor melting in your mouth without having to worry about making conversation. It’s seriously that good. Be sure to pair your meal with one of their fabulous cocktails — another highlight on the menu. I would say that, in general, I am difficult to please when it comes to food/restaurants, but Woodwind has left me absolutely speechless. And for the price, there’s no beating it. This is a place that immediately gained a top spot on my list of favorite restaurants, and I’ll definitely be going back over and over again.

I went there this past Monday night with my family and It was busy and crowded and we still received an excellent service + a good comfortable table. The operations manager “German” greeted us and offered us a tour of the restaurant. I will definitely comeback. It’s worth $$ trying and I recommended it.
Awesome drinks, good food, great view

(Translated by Google) An excellent place, ready for any type of event, including banquets with a large capacity, a delicious meal and especially an atmosphere and an amazing view  (Original) Un excelente lugar, listo para cualquier tipo de evento, incluso banquetes con una gran capacidad, una comida deliciosa y sobre todo un ambiente y una vista asombrosa
Food was great, atmosphere great, great service. You should come to see this place is beautiful, nice bar. Terrace is beautiful.
